metadata.title: CVE-2017-2666 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: It was discovered in Undertow that the code that parsed the HTTP requestline permitted invalid characters. This could be exploited, in conjunctionwith a proxy that also permitted the invalid characters but with adifferent interpretation, to inject data into the HTTP response. Bymanipulating the HTTP response the attacker could poison a web-cache,perform an XSS attack, or obtain sensitive information from requests otherthan their own.

criterions.comment: undertow: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
